title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children
Interview Descriptions: Quick and Easy. The staff were very nice and easy to talk to. They asked a series of question and then let me ask a couple. I got an offer and started not even two weeks later.
Interview Questions: Are you proficient in Word and Excel?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children (Frisco, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 rounds of interview. The first two rounds were short and over the phone and final round was in person where I met with a group of 4 doctors and people currently in the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children
Interview Descriptions: It was great! I got a tour and everyone is so friendly, you have a 1:1 with the department manager, after the interview process they let you know when they will call you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what type of previous experience you have

title: Summer Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children
Interview Descriptions: I know some areas had different types of interviews (ex. panel, two on one, Skype, etc), but mine was a one on one interview, at the facility in Dallas. Very friendly and open, explained the process of what would happen afterwards. Asked how I would handle certain situations, why I chose nursing, etc. After applying heard back around a month after about interviewing, set up online. After the interview process, it was about 1-2 weeks before receiving an email asking to call regarding the position, at which point I was told I was selected and accepted my position.
Interview Questions: Have you ever experienced a conflict with a  difficult mentor/day in clinical rotations? Explain what happened.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children (Plano, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the North campus for sports medicine and fracture clinic.  There were 3 people, the director, nurse manager, and nurse. They were all friendly and nice, making the interview smooth.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be nurse?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly simple. You apply online and if they think you're a good fit then you are scheduled for an interview, after that you're scheduled for a drug test and depending on how that goes and how your background is you'll get an offer for employment.

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They asked for you to bring a list of objectives of what you wish to get out of the program and your unofficial transcript. They sent an email with a link to sign-up for an interview time. There were two managers and one clinical coordinator. They were nice and so were the volunteers for the hospital.
Interview Questions: If we asked your best friend what two of your best qualities (and two you need to work on), what would they say?

title: Summer Nurse Externship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Scottish Rite for Children (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by 2 managers. It was in small office and casual. They asked me many questions to figure out my experiences and my personality. They asked specific questions with patient scenarios. 

I had met both of them at the open house for the program. Overall, it was a great learning experience.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work for them
